name: Dr. S. Santhosh
summary: Assistant Professor and researcher focused on sustainable materials, lightweight concrete, and AI-assisted material property prediction. Experienced in teaching, lab supervision and academic leadership.
summary_long: Dr. S. Santhosh is an Assistant Professor with experience in Structural Engineering, Construction Management and materials research. He has authored multiple publications, filed design patents, guided student projects and contributed to academic leadership and quality assurance activities.
phd_title: Effect of Oil Palm Shell in Light Weight Concrete Using M-Sand as Fine Aggregate
phd_abstract: A study on the mechanical and durability performance of lightweight concrete mixes using oil palm shell and modern mix design techniques. Includes experimental testing and statistical analysis.
research_interests: Lightweight concrete, sustainable construction materials, AI/ML for material property prediction, 3D-printable concrete mixes, structural health monitoring.
